dkeep.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game.java - class that handles all the game logic , where the levels are created
    Author:
    Joao Fidalgo & Francisco Friande

      • Game

        public Game(Map map,
            float logic)
        Parameters:
        map - A variable of type Map.
        logic - A variable of type Float. If game is on level1 logic ==1.1||1.2||1.3 Class constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • searchGameElements

        public void searchGameElements()
        searches for all the elements of game in the Map

      • moveHandler

        public static void moveHandler(java.lang.String mov,
                               int[] cord)
        Parameters:
        mov - A variable of type String.
        cord - A variable of type Int[], that is the coords of the object to move. Changes the cord for each mov.

      • onSide

        public int onSide(int[][] aux)
        Parameters:
        aux - A variable of type Int[][].Is the coords of some object/s of game.
        Returns:
        i Index of the aux that is on a adjacent cell.-1 in case of not found.

      • printTable

        public void printTable()
        Prints Map in console.

      • setElemTable

        public void setElemTable(int[] coord,
                         java.lang.String s)
        Parameters:
        coord - A variable of type Int[]. Represents the map coordinate to be changed.
        s - String variable, which will replace the String in coord. Replaces a String in Map.

      • isWin

        public boolean isWin()
        Returns:
        True if the Game is in its Win state, false if not. Funcion to check if the game is won.

      • isLose

        public boolean isLose()
        Returns:
        True if the Game is in its Lose state, false if not. Funcion to check if the game is lost.

      • setWin

        public void setWin(boolean b)
        Parameters:
        b - Boolean that will determine Game's Win state. Sets Game to Win state.

      • getMap

        public java.lang.String[][] getMap()
        Returns:
        String[][], a matrix of the game's current Map. Gets Map matrix of Strings.

      • getLogic

        public float getLogic()
        Returns:
        A variable of type float-the current game logic to be followed. Returns game's logic:

        1.1f if the current level is 1 and the Guard is Rookie.

        1.2f if the current level is 1 and the Guard is Drunken.

        1.3f if the current level is 1 and the Guard is Suspicious.

        2.0f if the current level is 2.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(boolean k)
        Parameters:
        k - Boolean variable to be applied in key-catched state. Sets the key-catched state to k.

      • getCatched

        public boolean getCatched()
        Returns:
        True if the game's key-catched state is true, false if not. Tells if key is catched or not.

      • getKeyCoord

        public int[] getKeyCoord()
        Returns:
        Return type int[] of the key's coordinates. Function to recieve key's position.

      • checkLose

        public void checkLose()
        Checks and sets Game's loose state, covering all game possibilities and exceptions of losing.

      • mvHero

        public void mvHero(java.lang.String mov)
        Parameters:
        mov - String type parameter of the movement of the Hero. Calls for hero's movement function according to the mov String.

      • getHeroSimbol

        public java.lang.String getHeroSimbol()
        Returns:
        Returns the Hero current symbol. Gets Hero Symbol (A if hero is armed, H if not).

      • mvGuard

        public void mvGuard()
        Handles guard's movement, according to the game logic(guard's personality)

      • leverOn

        public void leverOn()
        Activates lever (level1) and turns all I's to S's

      • mvOgre

        public void mvOgre()
        Moves all ogres in game and swings their clubs, also checks if the ogres get stunned.

      • checkStun

        public void checkStun()
        Checks if the ogres gets stunned.

      • getOgresCoord

        public int[][] getOgresCoord()
        Returns:
        An array of ogre's coordinates (also an array of integers). Function to get all ogres' positions.

      • getEnemysCoord

        public int[][] getEnemysCoord()
        Returns:
        Array of enemys' coordinates. Returns only clubs' coordinates if the hero is armed and both ogres' and clubs' coordinates if the Hero is unarmed.

      • delClub

        public void delClub()
        Functions's purpose is to erase all active ogre's clubs from map.

      • getStun

        public boolean getStun(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - Integer type variable of the Ogre's index.
        Returns:
        True if the given Ogre is stunned, false if not. Gets the Stun state of the given Ogre (ogre of the index i).

      • ogreCol

        public int ogreCol(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - Integer type variable of the Ogre's index.
        Returns:
        Returns an Integer of the Ogre's index which is collided with Ogre of index i, if there is no collision returns -1. Checks if it has occurred a collision between Ogre of index i, and, if so, returns the index of the other Ogre.

        If no collision, returns -1.

        Collision means two Ogres are placed in the same position.

      • getClubPosition

        public int[] getClubPosition(int i)
        Parameters:
        i - Index of the Ogre, which club is to be checked.
        Returns:
        A Integer[] variable of the Ogre's club coordinates. Gets a specific Ogre's club position.

      • getHeroPosition

        public int[] getHeroPosition()
        Returns:
        A Integer[] variable of the Hero's coordinates. Gets Hero position in the Map.

      • getCurrLevel

        public int getCurrLevel()
        Returns:
        An Integer of the current Game level. Gets the current level of the game.

      • isOgreKey

        public boolean isOgreKey()
        Returns:
        Boolean variable of the collision between Ogre and key- true if so, false if not. Tells if the Ogre is on top of the key or not.
